summary: Single-page marketing website for HOTEL NASRA DA with HND branding; keep the existing menu text exactly unchanged, and currently remove/hide the per-menu-item photos from the Menu item cards; fix the HND logo to have a properly removed/transparent background; update overall text colors to be lighter for readability on the dark theme.
architectural_notes: Menu content should be stored in the centralized content configuration (same TS object/file as other business details) and rendered as text (no menu image dependency).

Potential scope change: user requests images for each menu item, which conflicts with the prior requirement that the menu be text-only (no menu image dependency). Clarify/decide whether to allow per-item images and how they will be sourced/stored.
Branding update: add/use an 'HND' logo in the header/hero start area and remove/avoid the existing map logo.
Menu item imagery requirement: each menu item image must be distinct; avoid reusing the same photo across items.
User requested a navigation-driven/conditional rendering layout: keep Contact/Location on the main view and reveal other sections on button click (instead of showing all sections at once).

Ordering UX requirement: add a per-menu-item 'Order' CTA that deep-links to WhatsApp (wa.me / click-to-chat) with a prefilled message including the item name (and optionally price), so the user can order that specific item.

Ordering UX enhancement: if an item has multiple variants (e.g., Half/Full), the Order flow should first collect the user’s selection and include the chosen variant (and corresponding price if shown) in the WhatsApp pre-filled message.
User requirement update: ensure the page/site background is not transparent (avoid unintended transparency in global layout/background layers).
User requirement: menu item naming may need to be standardized with an 'HND' prefix before item names (confirm exact formatting: e.g., 'HND <Item Name>').
Menu imagery requirement clarification: for each written menu item (e.g., Pizza), display the matching item photo alongside it (no generic/full-menu image usage).
known_issues: Images are not displaying correctly on the site (user reported missing/incorrect image rendering).
Build/deployment failing due to a "System configuration error" (platform/system-level error).
User reports the website background is transparent and should be fixed (should render as solid/dark background).

Homepage/section reveal behavior is incorrect: when clicking navigation buttons, sections appear in a way that still feels like everything is on one long scrolling page; user wants content to be conditionally shown per button (not all sections visible at once).
imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Cleanly remove any non-transparent background/edges (hnd-logo-badge-chef-transparent.dim_512x512.png > hnd-logo-badge-chef-transparent-fixed.dim_512x512.png)
- Cleanly remove any non-transparent background/edges (hnd-favicon-badge-chef.dim_64x64.png > hnd-favicon-badge-chef-fixed.dim_64x64.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website (single-page) for the place referenced by https://maps.app.goo.gl/NdbP8XBnMzZHEdmM8, with clear sections for: hero (name + short tagline), about/description, hours, address, contact (phone/email placeholders if not known), and a location section that includes a prominent button linking to the Google Maps URL.

Add an embedded map preview in the location section (e.g., Google Maps embed/iframe when feasible) and provide a graceful fallback to a static location card with the “Open in Google Maps” link if embedding is blocked by browser policy/config.

Establish a coherent visual theme and layout system for the site (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all sections. Choose a distinctive style appropriate for a local business website and avoid a blue/purple primary palette.

Add basic SEO and accessibility: set a descriptive page title and meta description, ensure headings use a logical hierarchy (H1/H2/H3), interactive elements are keyboard accessible, and key icons/images have appropriate alt text.

Include a simple, centralized content configuration (e.g., a single TS file/object) for business name, tagline, description, hours, address, and contact details, and wire the UI to read from it so updating site content is straightforward.
Add the required generated images to the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the hero and/or branding area of the site.
Update the site branding to use the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA” everywhere it appears (header/site title, hero H1, footer, and centralized content config).
Update SEO metadata to reflect the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA” by setting an appropriate HTML `<title>` and meta description in `frontend/index.html` (English).

Add a new text-based “Menu” section to the single-page site (do not display the uploaded menu images). The menu content must include all items and prices from the 4 uploaded menu images (FB_IMG_1771102731629.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102734566.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102727004.jpg, FB_IMG_1771102729097.jpg) transcribed into English text where needed and organized into clear categories.
Add navigation access to the new Menu section: include a “Menu” link/button in the fixed header navigation and in the footer quick links that smooth-scrolls to the Menu section.

Extend the centralized content configuration (`frontend/src/content/business.ts`) to include structured menu data (categories and items), and render the Menu section from this configuration so future edits do not require modifying React component markup.

Make the website use a premium dark UI as the default appearance (dark background, high-contrast readable typography, and refined surfaces), without adding any new site sections or changing existing content text.

Upgrade the Menu section UI to a more premium design: use a card/grid layout for menu items, improved spacing/typography, and more polished Tabs styling while keeping the existing tab categories and menu data structure-driven rendering.

Add an image/photo next to every menu item in the Menu section. Extend the centralized menu data in frontend/src/content/business.ts to support an image reference per item, and render that image for each menu item with accessible alt text.

Ensure every menu item displays a unique image (no repeated photos across different menu items) by updating `frontend/src/content/business.ts` so each menu item points to its own distinct static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated`.
Remove any visible 'PREMIUM' text from all generated food/menu photos used on the site and replace it with 'HND' on the image artwork itself (not as HTML overlay text).
Create and apply an 'HND' brand logo for the top/starting branding area and replace map/pin-style branding in the header, hero logo, and footer with the HND logo (do not use a map logo for branding).

Improve the overall UI polish (spacing, typography hierarchy, alignment, and component consistency) across the single-page site while keeping existing section structure and keeping user-facing text in English.

Change the homepage behavior so that not all sections are shown immediately: keep the main view focused on Contact and Location, and show other sections (e.g., About, Menu, Hours) only after the user clicks their respective navigation buttons.

Update header and footer navigation behavior so that section buttons both reveal the target section (if hidden) and then navigate/scroll to it; ensure Contact and Location remain accessible from the main view.

Fix the site images that are not displaying correctly (broken/missing images), especially menu item images, by ensuring image asset paths match actual files and adding a graceful UI fallback when an image fails to load.

Replace the current HND logo used in the header and hero with the user-provided HND logo image (uploaded as `Picsart_26-02-15_02-31-07-789.png`) by adding an optimized logo asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and updating the UI to reference it consistently (header logo, hero logo, and any other existing logo placements).

Update the Menu UI so that every menu item (across all categories/tabs) displays: (1) its unique photo (from `businessContent.menu[].items[].image`), (2) its name and price(s), and (3) an "Order on WhatsApp" button next to/on the item card. Ensure the layout is consistent across all tabs (no categories rendered as text-only lists).

Implement per-item WhatsApp ordering: clicking an item's "Order on WhatsApp" button must open WhatsApp (web/app) with a pre-filled message that includes the selected item name and any displayed price(s). Add a configurable WhatsApp phone number (international format) and an optional message template to `frontend/src/content/business.ts` and use it to generate the WhatsApp deep link.
Identify and fix the root cause of the Caffeine build/deployment failure that reports “System configuration error”, ensuring the project builds successfully in the platform environment.

Make the Tailwind configuration compatible with the build toolchain by removing any module-format mismatch (e.g., ESM-only imports/exports) that could break Tailwind/Vite processing in the deployment environment.

Update the Menu item card layout so each menu item clearly shows its photo next to (beside) the item name and prices in a consistent, responsive layout (e.g., image thumbnail on the left with text/prices on the right), while keeping the existing grid/tabs structure and English UI text.

When a user clicks “Order on WhatsApp” for a menu item that has multiple size/variant prices (e.g., Half/Full, Small/Medium/Large, Beef/Chicken, Single/Family), show an in-page selection UI (modal/dialog) prompting the user to choose one available variant before opening WhatsApp.

Update WhatsApp order link generation so that, after the user selects a variant, the WhatsApp message includes: (1) the item name, (2) the selected variant label (e.g., “Half”, “Full”), and (3) the selected price, all in English.

Apply the user-provided HND logo image (`Picsart_26-02-15_02-31-07-789-1.png`) across the site by adding an optimized copy under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and updating all current HND logo references to use the new asset consistently (header logo, hero logo, and footer logo).

Fix the website background so it is never transparent: ensure `html`, `body`, and the app root render a solid dark background color across all sections and during scroll (no page-level transparency showing through).

Update the HND logo to be restaurant-appropriate and ensure the logo image itself has a transparent background; apply the updated logo consistently anywhere the HND logo is shown (header, hero, footer, and any other existing placements).

Correct the Menu so every menu item displays its own correct photo (matching the written item) and photos are not repeated due to missing/broken paths: audit `frontend/src/content/business.ts` image references and the static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` so each menu item loads its unique image without falling back to a shared default.
Standardize menu item naming so that menu item titles use the 'HND' prefix consistently before each item name (e.g., 'HND Chicken Karahi'), while keeping user-facing text in English.

Add an HND logo overlay (watermark) on top of every menu item photo shown in the Menu section, using the existing HND logo asset (`/assets/generated/hnd-logo-restaurant-transparent.dim_512x512.png`) and rendering it as an image overlay (not as HTML text). The overlay must appear consistently on every `MenuItemCard` image thumbnail and must not block core photo visibility.

Audit `frontend/src/content/business.ts` menu items and update each `businessContent.menu[].items[].image` so that every menu item shows a photo of the same dish (e.g., Pizza items must use Pizza photos), avoiding any generic/incorrect images and avoiding reusing the same photo for different menu items.

Standardize menu item photos to use static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (not `/assets/` uploads/screenshots) by moving/replacing the referenced files and updating `frontend/src/content/business.ts` to point to the generated asset paths.

Add configurable Facebook and TikTok social profile URLs to the centralized content config (`frontend/src/content/business.ts`) and wire the UI to use these values (do not hardcode social URLs in components). Use the exact URLs provided by the user: Facebook `https://www.facebook.com/share/189s9DRTtK/` and TikTok `https://www.tiktok.com/@hotel.nasry.da?_r=1&_t=ZS-93vS7fFgyn4`.

Add visible social buttons/links for Facebook and TikTok on the homepage main view (e.g., within the Hero section in `frontend/src/App.tsx`), styled consistently with the existing premium dark UI. Each social link must open in a new tab and include accessible labeling (e.g., `aria-label` values in English).

Update the footer “Connect With Us” links in `frontend/src/App.tsx` to reflect the business’s actual social presence by showing Facebook and TikTok using the configured URLs from `businessContent`, and remove/avoid placeholder social links (e.g., `https://facebook.com`, `https://instagram.com`, `https://x.com`) unless explicitly configured.

Update the Menu item card layout so each menu item consistently renders the item name/prices on the left and the food photo on the right (desktop/tablet), while remaining responsive (stacking appropriately on small screens). Keep the existing menu data structure and WhatsApp ordering behavior unchanged.

Remove category thumbnail photos from the menu category header UI so the category header displays only the category title (no category image blocks). This applies to all menu categories rendered by MenuCategoryGrid.

Apply a more modern premium restaurant menu visual styling to the Menu section using a dark background with gold and/or neon accents, while keeping all existing English UI text and the current section structure. Add a dedicated Menu section background image asset and use it as the Menu section backdrop (with an overlay to preserve readability).

Ensure the HND logo watermark overlay on every menu item photo looks like a modern, premium, slightly transparent watermark and does not obstruct the food photo. Keep using the existing HND logo asset for the overlay.

Add new generated logo image assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` that match the provided design: modern circular badge for brand text “HND” with a red outer circular border, white inner background, a friendly minimal cartoon chef (smiling) holding a pizza tray, wearing a chef hat and scarf; the “HND” text must be bold, modern, rounded, and use red and green; the asset must be clean, minimal, professional, high-resolution, vector-style, transparent background, with no watermark, blur, or extra text.

Update the site UI to use the new HND badge logo asset for all current logo placements (header logo and hero logo), replacing the existing `/assets/generated/hnd-logo-restaurant-transparent.dim_512x512.png` references.
Add favicon configuration in `frontend/index.html` to use the new favicon asset so browsers display the HND badge in the tab icon.

Generate and integrate ultra HD (4K) high-quality realistic food photography for every single menu item listed in `frontend/src/content/business.ts`, ensuring each item has its own unique, dish-accurate photo (no repeats, no generic mismatches). Store the photos as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and update the menu image references so the UI renders the correct per-item image next to the item text (text on the left, image on the right) for the entire menu without skipping any item.

Create and use a dedicated transparent-background HND watermark logo asset for overlaying on every menu item photo, and update the menu item photo overlay to use this watermark so it appears small, premium, clear, and slightly transparent above each food image across the entire menu.

Update the section reveal/navigation behavior so the page does not become a single long scrolling page where previously opened sections remain visible. Keep Contact and Location visible by default, but for the other sections (About, Menu, Hours) ensure only one of these sections is visible at a time: when the user clicks a navigation button for About/Menu/Hours, reveal that section and simultaneously hide the other non-default sections, then smooth-scroll to the revealed section.

Update the section visibility behavior so the site no longer feels like a single long scrolling page: at any time, only ONE main section is visible (Contact, Location, About, Menu, or Hours). Scrolling must not reveal other sections; content should change only when a navigation button is clicked (similar to a “new page” experience, but within the SPA).

Refactor `frontend/src/hooks/useRevealableSections.ts` and `frontend/src/App.tsx` to remove the concept of “always visible” sections and instead drive ALL sections (Contact, Location, About, Menu, Hours) through the same single-active-section mechanism using `RevealableSection` so only the active section is mounted in the DOM.

Update navigation click behavior so that when a user clicks a header navigation item (About/Menu/Hours/Contact/Location), the app activates the corresponding section and then scrolls to the top of that section (or page top) to reinforce the “new page” feel.

Remove the “Deals” category/section from the Menu so it is not shown anywhere in the UI (no Menu tab for Deals, and no Deals items rendered). Update the centralized menu configuration in `frontend/src/content/business.ts` accordingly, without changing any other menu item names/prices/categories.

Ensure the HND logo used in the header and hero (`/assets/generated/hnd-logo-badge-chef.dim_512x512.png`) has a transparent background, and update the UI references if the asset filename changes so the logo appears without any visible background box on the dark theme.

Update the mobile header/navigation so the primary section links (About, Menu, Hours, Contact, Location) are directly visible on mobile screens (no 3-line/hamburger menu required) and remain visible across the site.

Change section navigation behavior so that clicking any navigation item swaps the main content in-place (single active section) and brings the newly activated section into view at the top of the viewport (accounting for the fixed header), rather than feeling like content is appearing below on a long scrolling homepage.

Remove/hide the per-menu-item food photos from the Menu item cards so each Menu item displays text content (name, description/note if present, and all prices) plus the existing WhatsApp ordering button/variant-selection behavior, but no food image thumbnail is shown.
Remove the HND watermark/logo overlay that is currently rendered on top of each Menu item photo (since Menu item photos are being removed).

Fix the HND logo image assets used in the header and hero so the logo image itself has a clean, fully transparent background (no visible background box/edges on the dark theme). Update any UI references if the logo filenames change.

Update site-wide text colors to be lighter/more readable on the premium dark theme by adjusting the theme tokens/styles so that muted text (e.g., tagline, descriptions, secondary labels) is noticeably brighter while maintaining contrast and hierarchy.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website for the business/location referenced by the provided Google Maps link.
Update site branding/content to use the business name “HOTEL NASRA DA”.
Add a Menu section with menu items/details as text/content (not as an image).
Switch the site UI to a premium dark theme design.
Enhance the Menu section with a premium design and add a photo/image for each menu item.
Ensure all menu item photos are unique (no repeated images).
Update/replace any 'PREMIUM' text on photos to 'HND' (remove 'PREMIUM').
Improve the overall UI styling ('UI acha sa bnao') beyond current premium dark theme.
Create an 'HND' logo and place it at the start/top; do not use the map logo.
Change the homepage layout so not everything is shown on the first view; show key content/sections when their respective buttons are clicked, while keeping Contact/Location visible on the main page.
Fix site images that are not displaying correctly (broken/missing/incorrect rendering).
Add an 'Order' button for each menu item that opens WhatsApp with a pre-filled message containing that selected item (and relevant details).
When clicking a menu item’s Order button, prompt the user to select an available size/variant (e.g., Half/Full where applicable) before opening WhatsApp with the pre-filled message.
Fix the site/page background so it is not transparent (ensure proper solid/dark background rendering).
Standardize menu item naming to include 'HND' as a prefix before each item name where required by the user.
Update/replace the HND logo so it is restaurant-appropriate and ensure the logo asset background is transparent.
Add the HND logo on top of each menu item photo (apply logo overlay/watermark per image so each item photo has HND branding).
Add Facebook and TikTok social buttons/links on the homepage (using the provided URLs).

Revise Menu item card layout to keep item names/text on the left and the correct food photo on the right, using a clean premium dark menu style with gold/neon accents; remove existing/incorrect menu photos and re-add correct dish photos per item (e.g., pizza items use pizza images).

Create a modern circular badge 'HND' logo (red outer circular border, white inner background) with a friendly cartoon chef holding a pizza tray, and 'HND' text in bold rounded typography using red/green; deliver as high-res vector-style asset with transparent background suitable for website header and favicon.
Generate Ultra HD/4K high-quality realistic food photos for every menu item (each item unique and dish-accurate) for use in premium digital menu cards.

Auto-generate and display a realistic, high-quality, dish-accurate individual image for each menu item next to its existing text, without editing any menu text and without using full-menu photos; images must be proportional and match the website style, keeping the existing layout unchanged aside from adding the image.
Remove/hide the “Deals” content/section from the menu (user requested: 'deal hata do').

Update navigation/section UX so Menu/Hours/About are directly visible on the homepage (including mobile) without requiring the 3-line (hamburger) menu; clicking a button should swap/show the target content in the main view (not appear below/after scrolling).
Remove/hide the photos currently displayed on menu items in the Menu section (menu items should display without item photos).
Update site-wide text colors to a lighter palette for better readability on the dark theme.

projectName: Create a single-page website for the Google Maps location
